reviews.review_msg: She is a wonderfully clear lecturer who definitely makes a note to express the terms in class that she finds important and allows for an easy understanding. Participation is important but she always makes broad enough questions that are easy to answer just based on opinion. The texts were surprisingly interesting. Overall amazing class.

I agree with previous comments about the class needing more structure.  The class discussion was almost entirely student led.  It may not seem like it, but Christine is extremely helpul and encouraging.  She took the time to look at a draft of my final paper and gave me all kinds of helpful feedback on how I could improve it.  Overall, okay prof.

Enjoyed the class. Sophie is nice and reasonable. I didn't enjoy the group projects in tutorials - everyone gets the same grade and I'm just not a fan of group projects and presentations. It wasn't horrible but requires time outside of class to meet with group. Assigned small tasks in tutorials for the next week. Nice teacher but makes you work.

Sophie is a nice person, and goes easy with marking but is intimating sometimes when she doesn't agree with someone or something you're saying, which kind of seems like she is trying to intentionally make you look stupid. She has crazy eyes, but that doesn't bug me unless I look her right in the eye. Don't need to go to class pretty much ever.

Sophie is great. She communicates her material effectively as well as chooses material that is interesting and engaging. She marks fairly, is understanding and lenient with extensions and is so friendly and approachable. She really is one of the best Eng. profs @ SFU. One piece of advice though: stay away from passive voice!

Sophie puts together a good English course.  Her outline is organized, she provides references, handouts, and other valuable material to encourage student research. Cares about her students doing well. Loves art, shows slides, field trip to art gallery.
Very enthusiastic, knows her material and is really involved with literary community. Great field trips and new ideas. For a required course it was a fantastic surprise.
organized, flexible, & with good ideas, but not a particularly good/experienced lecturer
